page.title: 13Stage Coach Stop
page.content: From the time of William the Conqueror's survey until the coming of the first stage wagons on the local roads in the middle of the sixteenth century the Frogmill would have changed but little.The roads were only rough tracks and the Frogmarsh which adjoined the Coln was a treacherous place for pack horses and travellers.Even medieval records refer to this area as Frogmarsh and the present inn must have got its name from this source.When the long- wagons gave place to the stage coaches at the end of the seventeenth century, the Frogmill became a very important staging inn.Here stopped for a change of horses many famous coaches and by the 1830's at least twenty coaches were changing teams here daily.
